item.description:
My good friend @dsearls has a feed for his tweets.

https://t.co/MAUXR2tcLH

I use https://t.co/Amj9KSgUUp to link to feeds because all browsers make a mess of displaying feeds.

Suggestion to browser devs: treat viewing a feed as lifting the hood on a car. When you do that, you don't see another car interior, you see a lot of technical stuff.

Trust people who don't want to know how the web works will quickly hit the Back button to get back to the comfort of the user interface.

Think of viewing the source of a feed is like viewing the source of an HTML page.
item.source:markdown:
My good friend @dsearls has a feed for his tweets.
https://t.co/MAUXR2tcLH
I use https://t.co/Amj9KSgUUp to link to feeds because all browsers make a mess of displaying feeds.
Suggestion to browser devs: treat viewing a feed as lifting the hood on a car. When you do that, you don't see another car interior, you see a lot of technical stuff.
Trust people who don't want to know how the web works will quickly hit the Back button to get back to the comfort of the user interface.
Think of viewing the source of a feed is like viewing the source of an HTML page.

item.description:

item.description:
@Conaw @rosiesherry @RoamResearch I now know how to answer this question.

It adds the item to a relational database table, with the [[bracketed]] word as the key.

You can then get a list of all posts that have that key, all the nodes that are adjacent in the graph.

Excellent way of putting it @conaw.

It's the same idea that powers the web, brought to writing and collaborating. https://t.co/7JJhq9SQ2X
item.source:markdown:
Excellent way of putting it @conaw.
It's the same idea that powers the web, brought to writing and collaborating. https://t.co/7JJhq9SQ2X

item.description: @jacquie_rn @jadeecee1 @AWeissmann_ @MuellerSheWrote i'm not a lawyer -- but right -- when you're given immunity you have to tell them everything and it has to be 100 percent the truth or you lose the immunity.
item.source:markdown: @jacquie_rn @jadeecee1 @AWeissmann_ @MuellerSheWrote i'm not a lawyer -- but right -- when you're given immunity you have to tell them everything and it has to be 100 percent the truth or you lose the immunity.

Reliable Sources was the most lost of a very lost media.

Same old story every time. Still trying to live in a world that's long gone.
